Planet

public class Planet: Object, CelestialBody, PlanetaryBase, PlanetaryPhenomena, ElementsOfPlanetaryOrbit, EllipticalPlanetaryDetails, IlluminatedFraction

The Planet class encompasses all the shared properties of the planets, to be understood as non-Earth planets.

  • averageColor

    Convenience accesor for the average color of the planet, making it easier to draw a solar system. :-)

    Swift

    public class var averageColor: Color

  • equatorialCoordinates

    The equatorial coordinates of the planet. That is, its position on the celestial sphere, as it would be seen by an observer at rest at the barycenter of the solar system – See AA.149).

    Declaration

    Swift

    public var equatorialCoordinates: EquatorialCoordinates
    Show on GitHub
  • apparentEquatorialCoordinates

    The apparent equatorial coordinates of the planet. That is, its apparent position on the celestial sphere, as it is actually seen from the center of the moving Earth, and referred to the instantaneous equator, ecliptic and equinox. It accounts for 1) the effect of light-time and 2) the effect of the Earth motion. See AA p224.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public var apparentEquatorialCoordinates: EquatorialCoordinates
    Show on GitHub
  • eclipticCoordinates

    The ecliptic (or celestial) coordinates of the planet

    Declaration

    Swift

    public var eclipticCoordinates: EclipticCoordinates
    Show on GitHub
  • radiusVector

    The radius vector of the planet (that is, its distance to the Sun).

  • apparentRiseSetAltitude

    the standard altitude of the planet, that is, the geometric altitude of the center of the body at the time of apparent rising or setting. There is a value for the stars and planets, and one for the Sun. See AA p.101 for more explanations

    Declaration

    Swift

    public let apparentRiseSetAltitude = ArcMinute(-34).inDegrees
    Show on GitHub
